subject: Economics
title: Automation Anxiety: Will Robots Take Your Job?
description: One-minute skill: Automation Anxiety: Will Robots Take Your Job?.

hook.text: A 2013 Oxford study predicted 47% of US jobs could be automated within 20 years.

buildup.text: Automation fear is ancient. Luddites smashed textile machines in 1811. ATMs were supposed to kill bank tellers.

discovery.text: The 'lump of labor fallacy': assuming there's a fixed amount of work.

twist.text: But AI is different from past automation.

climax.text: History says automation creates more jobs than it destroys. But history has never seen machines that think.

punchline.text: Every generation fears machines will replace them.

quiz.question: Why might AI automation be different from previous waves of automation?
options: AI threatens cognitive and creative jobs that previous automation waves left untouched ‚Äî tasks requiring thinking, not just physical labor
